text: Brian Douglas Williams (born May 5, 1959) is the anchor of NBC Nightly News, the evening newscast of NBC. He used to anchor the NBC News broadcast The News with Brian Williams on NBC's sister networks CNBC and MSNBC. On February 10, 2015, Williams was suspended for six months without pay. That was done because he reported false stories regarding his trips to Iraq in 2003 and to New Orleans during the aftermath of Hurricane Katrina in 2005. ==References== Category:American journalists Category:Living people Category:1959 births Category:American television news anchors category:Writers from New Jersey Category:People from Ridgewood, New Jersey
title: Brian Williams
